tossups.question: m6A ("m-6-A") modifications in one form of these molecules prevents TLR3 ("t-l-r-3") and TLR7 ("t-l-r-7") from recognizing their foreign origin. tossups.question: In a novel by this author, a character who has been forced to marry the town schoolteacher jumps out of the window when he tries to have sex. That character created by this author does not have sex with her next husband until his legal wife returns from Australia, and her two children are later killed by Little Father Time. The title character marries Sue (*) Bridehead in that novel by this author. The title character of a novel by this author is arrested at Stonehenge after stabbing her rapist, Alec, and is divorced by her husband Angel Clare. Many of this author's novels are set in the fictional county of Wessex. For 10 points, name this British author of Jude the Obscure and Tess of the D'Urbervilles.
tossups.question_sanitized: In a novel by this author, a character who has been forced to marry the town schoolteacher jumps out of the window when he tries to have sex. That character created by this author does not have sex with her next husband until his legal wife returns from Australia, and her two children are later killed by Little Father Time. The title character marries Sue (*) Bridehead in that novel by this author. The title character of a novel by this author is arrested at Stonehenge after stabbing her rapist, Alec, and is divorced by her husband Angel Clare. Many of this author's novels are set in the fictional county of Wessex. For 10 points, name this British author of Jude the Obscure and Tess of the D'Urbervilles.
tossups.answer_sanitized: Thomas Hardy

bonuses.leadin: An art style from this country is characterized by the use of formlines and ovoid shapes. For 10 points each:
bonuses.leadin_sanitized: An art style from this country is characterized by the use of formlines and ovoid shapes. For 10 points each:
answers_sanitized: totem poles [prompt on totems or poles]
parts: Name this country, the northernmost country whose native people depicted creatures such as sisiutls ("sih-see-ooh-tulls") and thunderbirds in their art. Bill Reid, an artist from this country, championed its native art after discovering his Haida ancestry.
The best-known type of Northwest Coast art are these large wooden structures, which are carved from cedar trunks and painted, often telling a story in their design.

This Canadian artist drew inspiration from Fauvism and Northwest Coast art, including totem poles, in her art depicting the indigenous people of the British Columbian rainforest, such as in the painting Church at Yuquot Village.

answers_sanitized: Bhutto family [accept Zulfikar Ali Bhutto or Benazir Bhutto]
parts: The first amendment to Pakistan's constitution took place in 1974 and removed references to East Pakistan after it became this independent country.

The second amendment to Pakistan's constitution defined these people, known officially in Pakistan derisively as Qadianis ("cah-dee-ah-nees"). The followers of this messianic movement founded in 19th century India consider themselves Muslims.
The first and second amendments to Pakistan's constitution were passed under Zulfikar Ali, a member of this prominent Pakistani political dynasty which runs the Pakistan People's Party.

bonuses.leadin: Edwin Hubble developed his namesake law after observing Andromeda with the Hooker Telescope in this state. For 10 points each:
bonuses.leadin_sanitized: Edwin Hubble developed his namesake law after observing Andromeda with the Hooker Telescope in this state. For 10 points each:
answers_sanitized: Arizona (Flagstaff, Arizona is the "Dark Sky City")
parts: Name this state. The incredibly steady air above this state's city of Pasadena is perfect for Mount Wilson Observatory and Griffith Observatory.

The Keck Observatory in this state has astronomical seeing rivaled only by the Canary Islands. This state is the proposed location for the Thirty Meter Telescope, which has been delayed by protests from native groups.

After Gerard Kuiper lost the Keck contract, he retired to a university in this state. This state is home to the first International Dark Sky Place, which is near the Lowell Observatory where Clyde Tombaugh discovered Pluto and "Burnham's Celestial Handbook" was written.

parts: Name these mechanical devices which can maintain a stabilized platform. A standard set of three of these devices is vulnerable to a namesake “lock” when two of them align, losing a degree of freedom.

Each gimbal provides an axis for this kind of motion, which changes the angle something points at. The three types of this motion that a three-dimensional object can perform can be called yaw, pitch, and roll.

The Euler ("OIL-er") angles that describe gimbals are one way to parameterize this mathematical group, which describes rotations in three dimensions. This group is a connected subgroup of a similarly named group of isometries.
